segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely focused on drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn't even notice the water overflowing and creating a puddle around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost like she's in her own little world, oblivious to everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what she's thinking about, to be so distracted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids behind her are being so mischievous, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe how calm she seems, even with the water spilling everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really tired or lost in thought.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice her apron is neat and clean, despite the mess around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost funny how she's just standing there, drying that plate like nothing else is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone tells her about the water soon, before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but I don't want to startle her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene is so bizarre, yet it feels oddly familiar.
segments.speaker: PAR
